segment.source: How to Create an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Create an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Create an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Create an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: How to Create an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)
segment.target: How to Create an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1)

segment.source: You can use an App-V project template to save commonly applied settings associated with an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: You can use an App-V project template to save commonly applied settings associated with an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: These settings can then be applied when you create new virtual application packages in your environment which can help streamline the process of creating virtual application packages.
segment.target: These settings can then be applied when you create new virtual application packages in your environment which can help streamline the process of creating virtual application packages.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can only apply an App-V project template when you are creating a new virtual application package.
segment.target: You can only apply an App-V project template when you are creating a new virtual application package.

segment.source: Applying project templates to existing virtual application packages is not supported.
segment.target: Applying project templates to existing virtual application packages is not supported.

segment.source: For more information about applying an App-V project template, see How to Apply an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1).
segment.target: For more information about applying an App-V project template, see How to Apply an App-V Project Template (App-V 4.6 SP1).

segment.source: App-V project templates differ from App-V Application Accelerators because App-V Application Accelerators are application-specific, and App-V project templates can be applied to multiple applications.
segment.target: App-V project templates differ from App-V Application Accelerators because App-V Application Accelerators are application-specific, and App-V project templates can be applied to multiple applications.

segment.source: Additionally, you cannot use a project template when you use a Package Accelerator to create a virtual application package.
segment.target: Additionally, you cannot use a project template when you use a Package Accelerator to create a virtual application package.

segment.source: The following general settings are saved with an App-V project template:
segment.target: The following general settings are saved with an App-V project template:

segment.source: Advanced Monitoring Options.
segment.target: Advanced Monitoring Options.

segment.source: Enables Microsoft Update to run during monitoring, Rebase .dll’s.
segment.target: Enables Microsoft Update to run during monitoring, Rebase .dll’s.

segment.source: Package Deployment Settings.
segment.target: Package Deployment Settings.

segment.source: Contains Protocol, Host Name, Port, Path, Operating Systems, Enforce Security Descriptors, Create MSI, Compress Package.
segment.target: Contains Protocol, Host Name, Port, Path, Operating Systems, Enforce Security Descriptors, Create MSI, Compress Package.

segment.source: General Options.
segment.target: General Options.

segment.source: Allows you to Generate Microsoft Windows Installer (MSI) package, Allow Virtualization of Events, Allow Virtualization of Services, Append Package Version to Filename.
segment.target: Allows you to Generate Microsoft Windows Installer (MSI) package, Allow Virtualization of Events, Allow Virtualization of Services, Append Package Version to Filename.

segment.source: Exclusion Items.
segment.target: Exclusion Items.

segment.source: Contains the Exclusion pattern list.
segment.target: Contains the Exclusion pattern list.

segment.source: To create a project template
segment.target: To create a project template

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that is running the App-V Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: If the virtual application package is currently open in the App-V Sequencer, skip to step 3 of this procedure.
segment.target: If the virtual application package is currently open in the App-V Sequencer, skip to step 3 of this procedure.

segment.source: To open the existing virtual application package that contains the settings you want to save with the App-V project template, click FileOpen and click EditPackage.
segment.target: To open the existing virtual application package that contains the settings you want to save with the App-V project template, click FileOpen and click EditPackage.

segment.source: On the Select Package page, click Browse and locate the virtual application package that you want to open.
segment.target: On the Select Package page, click Browse and locate the virtual application package that you want to open.

segment.source: Click Edit.
segment.target: Click Edit.

segment.source: In the App-V Sequencer console, click FileSave As Template.
segment.target: In the App-V Sequencer console, click FileSave As Template.

segment.source: After you have reviewed the settings that will be saved with the new template, click OK.
segment.target: After you have reviewed the settings that will be saved with the new template, click OK.

segment.source: Specify a name that will be associated with the new App-V project template.
segment.target: Specify a name that will be associated with the new App-V project template.

segment.source: Click Save.
segment.target: Click Save.

segment.source: The new App-V project template is saved in the directory specified in step 3 of this procedure.
segment.target: The new App-V project template is saved in the directory specified in step 3 of this procedure.

segment.target: Related topics
